resources.string: Is shown in the notification area and on the lock screen as long as WalkersGuide is running.
Location permission denied. The app won\'t receive any location updates

The app won\'t receive any location updates because it is not allowed to send you notifications. Many of the WalkersGuide features, such as location tracking and recording a route, run in a service. Android requires such a service to display a notification if it wants to be executed permanently. Therefore, the app asks for this permission.
Points and routes are announced as you pass close by them.
Turn around slowly and listen to the points and routes in front of you.
When activated, the app gets its bearing information from satellite data, for example, when you put your smartphone upright in your pocket.
You can\'t select a bearing sensor manually, while the automatic switch-sensor option is enabled. Please see below to disable.
Select point or route to pin:
street and house number, city is optional

Here you can add point profiles and collections as well as points and routes for quick access.
Add points which you want to track. They will be announced via speech output periodically, depending on the tracking mode you have selected above.
Do you really want to cancel this recording? The already recorded route will be lost.
No routes have been recorded yet.
Please note, that your route only is recorded, as long as the app is in the foreground. When you lock the display or put WalkersGuide in the background, the route recording is paused.
Can\'t save the recorded route. It still contains too few points.
Please enter a name for the recorded route.
Error: Can\'t save the recorded route.

The line arrived at its destination stop.

If the map database has multiple languages stored for an entry, this setting ensures that the app outputs everything that\'s available in your set system language or, as a fallback, in English. For instance, the name of restaurants or attractions is occasionally available as an English translation.
Alternatively perform a long click to open the context menu.
Screen remains active, while the app is in use.
Disables the auto lock screen feature during navigation.
Shake to refresh "Where am I" Dialog and "Points" Tab.
Some Bluetooth headphones go to sleep after some time of inactivity and their subsequent awakening produces a noticeable delay. Then the start of the next voice announcement may be truncated.
Do you want to proceed with the import?
The map of which country is missing?
Which public transport provider is missing?
- Pin and track points and routes
- Collections to group and manage your points and routes

The structure of the app has also changed. The "Favorites" tab has been replaced by the "Overview" tab. Your existing favorites were transferred to a collection and can now be found in the overview tab under the pinned profiles section.
The tab bar at the bottom of the screen is now permanently visible, allowing for easier switching between the main views of the app.

Some tabs now have their own tab bar. If available, this is located in the top area of the screen. For example, the "Overview" tab has two subtabs called "Pin" and "Track". The newly named "Routes" tab, next to it, is divided into the subtabs "Navigate" and "Record".

You can also quickly access all sub-tabs from other parts of the app. To do this, focus on the corresponding tab at the bottom of the screen and perform a long click or swipe through the Talkback actions.
